content:
Diagnosis:		T2N1M0 squamous cell carcinoma of oral tongue

Management:		12 Jan 2024 Partial glossectomy and selective neck dissection
			15 Feb - 22 Mar 2024 Adjuvant chemoradiotherapy with weekly cisplatin

Histology:		Moderately differentiated squamous cell carcinoma, 2.8cm, depth of invasion 12mm, lymphovascular invasion present, perineural invasion present, 2/15 lymph nodes positive, PDL1 CPS 10

Current Situation:	Post-completion of chemoradiotherapy with grade 3 mucositis and dysphagia

[redacted name] attended clinic today following completion of adjuvant chemoradiotherapy. Unfortunately, she has developed significant grade 3 mucositis requiring nasogastric feeding and admission to hospital last week for symptom control. She completed 5/6 planned cycles of cisplatin, with the final cycle omitted due to deteriorating renal function. Her creatinine clearance has dropped from 85 to 45 ml/min. She has also developed grade 2 peripheral neuropathy affecting hands and feet.

Given the severity of side effects and completion of planned radiotherapy course, we will not administer the final cycle of cisplatin. She will continue with nasogastric feeding support and regular review by our dietetics team. Speech and language therapy assessment is arranged for next week. We have organized weekly clinical review until mucositis improves. Blood tests including renal function will be monitored. First post-treatment imaging will be arranged for 8 weeks' time.
